subject: Career
title: Six Degrees of Separation
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Six Degrees of Separation.

hook.text: You're six introductions away from anyone on earth. Stanley Milgram proved it in 1967.

buildup.text: Milgram asked random people in Nebraska to forward a letter to a stranger in Boston via personal contacts.

discovery.text: Letters that arrived took an average of six steps. The 'small world' phenomenon was born.

twist.text: LinkedIn data later confirmed: most professionals are 3-4 degrees apart, not six.

climax.text: The world is smaller than you think. Your dream contact is closer than you imagine.

punchline.text: Everyone is reachable. You just need the right path.

quiz.question: What did Milgram's small-world experiment demonstrate?
options: People are connected by about six degrees of separation
